sentences: Mehed ütlevad, et see on hea idee.
context: Ütlevad is the 3rd person plural present indicative form of the Estonian verb 'ütelda' (to say/tell). It means 'they say' or 'they tell'. This form is used when referring to what a group of people are saying. The root word 'ütle-' relates to speaking or expressing, and the '-vad' ending indicates present tense plural subject.
